captions.text: In this video I'm going to illustrate to you in very simple terms
why the Dollar and the Euro are mathematically guaranteed to collapse
and have been since the moment they were created.
You don't need to be an economist to understand what I'm going to show you.
A little common sense will do just fine.
The dollar and the Euro are debt based currencies created by the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank.
Now these central banks, while masquerading as public entities are actually made up of a consortium of the most
powerful private banks in the world. When I say that the Dollar and the Euro are debt based currencies
what this means is that dollars and euros are loaned into existence.
Central banks create money out of thin air by loaning money that does not yet exist
to their respective governments, since the vast mayority of money in circulation is now digital
Such an operation doesn't even requiere the printing of physical paper,
money and the debt that accompanies it is simply typed into existence
Now these privately owned central banks don't just loan up their imaginary money for free, they charge interest.
And the money to pay back that interest doesn't yet exist in the system.
Since all money is created this way, there's always more total debt plus interest to be payed back than there is money.
This forces governments to constantly return to those banks for more loans which create more money and interest.
This is obviously a ponzi scheme, and like all ponzi schemes it can only work for so long.
The inevitable result when there's more total debt to be paid due to interest than money in existance
is that eventually the debt will reach such astronomical proportions
that it will become impossible to service that debt.
This is why I said the collapse of the Dollar and the Euro is a matemathical certainty.
It's been guaranteed since the beginning on the very nature of our monetary system.
You might ask yourself why anybody in their right mind would set up a system like this
that's garanteed to fail. And the answer is simple,
the same reason that any criminal sets up a ponzi scheme.
There's a small group of bankers that get very, very rich at the expense of the public before the system begins to falter
and they use that money to buy real assets that maintain their value after the currency falls.
Sounds criminal to you? Well that's cause it is.
And you know what, they're gonna get away with it if we don't make a concentrated effort right now
to educate the public about the true nature of money and the private central banks
which are leading us to the slaughter. And if we let them get away with this this time
the next ponzi scheme is going to be even bigger.

title: Why a Dollar & Euro Collapse Is Guaranteed

comments.text:
The sheeple in the comments really amuse me. 

Despite an exponentially growing national deficit that will certainly never 
be repaid, and the continual devaluation of our currency, or the global 
hostility incubated by our foreign-policy or the geopolitical tensions 
created by the IMF, corruption levels reaching all time highs... I guess 
you sheeple just continue to lull yourself into a false sense of 
security... a 'normalcy bias'. As long as you have those yuppie reality TV 
shows, your social-media and your microwavable burritos... you have nothing 
to worry about!! 

Lets just ignore the growing military industrial complex that seems to defy 
and obliterate all common sense. Pay no attention to the disgusting 
military defense budget... or the fact that, despite having a mere fraction 
of the global population, the United States has the highest prison 
population IN THE ENTIRE FUCKING WORLD! 

Do not educate yourself. Don't concern yourself with the 
state-of-affairs... just piss in the wind with a shit-eating grin like me 
:D and everything will be hunky-dory okey-dokey!   

Well if you read the teachings of our founding fathers, you'll notice that 
every single one of them were firmly against a private federal banking 
system. In fact, Thomas Jefferson believed them to be more dangerous than 
standing armies! Come to think of it, America was founded on the principals 
of 'sovereignty' and the 2nd amendment. You could say that those two things 
alone were an adequate justification for the revolutionary war. 

The colonists started printing and using their own money! Then they fought 
and died to protect that right! 

The fact of the matter is that the federal reserve is anything BUT 
sovereign! It is appointed by NO-ONE and above any/all 'due process'. Do 
you not understand? I promise you that tomorrow the history of today will 
be written in blood.  

"I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties 
than standing armies,”  Jefferson wrote. ” If the American people ever 
allow private banks to control the issue of their currency, first by 
inflation, then by deflation, the banks and corporations that will grow up 
around(these banks) will deprive the people of all property until their 
children wake up homeless on the continent their fathers conquered." 
-Thomas Jefferson

Take a look around you! 

"The world will not be undone by men who do evil, but by men that watch and 
do nothing." -Einstein

Are you starting to GET IT yet?

"None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are 
free" -John Wolfgang Von goethe

ARE YOU STARTING TO WAKE UP?

"The time is near at hand (again) which must determine whether Americans 
are to be free men or slaves." - George Washington.

LISTEN TO ME

I'D RATHER DIE ON MY FEET THAN LIVE ON MY KNEES! 

So tell me... are you a SLAVE or a FREE MAN?﻿

Funny, I think we both have the same dream... I spent most of my younger 
years growing up in the southern states. I never had much but I didn't 
realize just how much I really had at the time.

I moved to Chicago in my teenage years and it didn't take long for me to 
realize that this culture is the cancer of humanity. 

It's crazy how society and money drive people so far apart, while at the 
same time these very things were built to bring us closer together.

We deify the natural symbiotic connections that truly unite us and we 
replace it with more individual, generic, acquisitive and apathetic 
pursuits of self-interest. We individualize our hardships and externalize 
the violence of our culture. Everybody isolated, increasing being pushed 
into a private world of their own. We have lost any real communion with 
each-other. It's all about gettin' whatchya CAN before SOMEBODY ELSE beats 
ya' to it!

Are we even human anymore?

Divided and conquered... vestigial corpses of our former selves. We're 
already dead, we just don't know it yet**

comments.text:
+poweredbyaaron99
@where am I going to run:

To a place where nature offers enough food/ resources for human beings to 
survive. I have been to the Fiji islands, where locals feed themselves with 
fish and homegrown vegetables because they have no money. They have 
recently won an award for "happiest society on earth" and they don't need 
money for it.
It's one of my wildest dreams to have a life like that, because banks and 
governments are not a part of it. My life is not controlled by mortgages, 
children that need my presence and a wife who eats chocolate all day.

But I agree with your conclusion. The collapse of the monetary system is 
inevitable, will destroy billions of lives and take down economies 
completely. Take a look at the growing inequality in terms of money on this 
planet. The 85 richest billionaires on the planet own almost half of all 
wealth. That's 85 people that own as much as the other 7 000 000 000 people.
The "one percenters" of America have everything and there is no middle 
class. You're only doing well if you belong to the richest 5% of society, 
meaning 95% of the population has no value. And it will become a lot worse 
by the end of 2015 when the US dollar collapses. More than 50% of Americans 
live from paycheck to paycheck (no savings), and there will be no more pay 
checks when the economy collapses. The clock is ticking for all of them.

Poverty, unemployment and the inevitable financial collapse will reduce the 
worlds population very drastically. America is a new 3rd world country, and 
others will follow

economy is rebuilt, leaving much of the world to starve to death in the 
ashes of our currently established industrialized world.

people are in poverty folks!!!! It's the constant, PERPETUALl watering down

comments.author: philburpalooza8

comments.text:
Of course, the buying power of a particular unit of currency itself is 
irrelevant. The relevant aspect is how many hours you need to work to 
achieve a particular standard of living, and the percentage of your income 
that food and housing costs, entertainment, health, etc. I.e. the 
inflation-adjusted standards of living. For what it's worth - The size of 
the average American home grew from about  1725 square feet in 1984 to 2600 
square feet in 2013. Cell phones in USA went from ~0 in 1990 to >300 
million today. The US population has grown almost 70 million in the same 
time. The real median household income (inflation adjusted) has declined 9% 
since 2009 and the sub-prime lending fiasco. We feel this pain as the 'new 
normal'. However, we often don’t recognize that median household income is 
still 8% higher than it was in 1985, and wish for the ‘good old days’. 
Since ’85, we have created the world wide web with broadband, YouTube, 
affordable personal computers, smart phones, color flat-panel televisions, 
GPS, hybrid and electric vehicles with air bags, giant wind turbines, 
breast cancer treatments, etc. Needless to say, the standard of living was 
significantly different in 1913. No broadcast radio, let alone TV, no air 
conditioning in homes and workplaces, iceboxes instead of refrigerators, 
less than 300,000 cars on the road in the entire USA. Dirt roads as 
highways and streets in most US towns. Trains, homes, and businesses 
burning coal. Influenza a deadly disease, polio, cholera epidemics in parts 
of Europe. Clearly the economic system has failed us over the last 100 
years and left the average man and woman in the USA homeless, unfed, and 
subjugated.
